cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 35 miles W of Cancun, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the southern-central Gulf of Mexico, then turning northward toward the Louisiana coast by late Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central to southwest Louisiana coast (near Cameron/Lake Charles area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches yet issued along the northern Gulf Coast (expected later today)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect along northern Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas–Louisiana border eastward to Mississippi/Alabama coastline
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (33–35%) of sustained 50-kt winds at the port with hurricane-force gusts possible late Friday; tropical-storm-force winds could begin late Thursday night or early Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening storm surge exceeding 3 ft is probable along the southwest Louisiana coast, especially near and east of the landfall point.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 4–8 inches with isolated totals up to 12 inches is forecast for southwest Louisiana Friday–Saturday, causing flash and urban flooding risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Coastal flooding, dangerous surf/rip currents, and the potential for tornadoes in outer rain bands.
